Rochester, N. Y. Rumrill-Hoyt, Inc.
Rochester's general theme is, "You Can Make It A Great Summer..",
with the public service advertising and publicity program geared to,
"Give Them A Vocation." Agency's Public Relations Division conducting and
coordinating continuing publicity program. A major target: raising $700,000
for Youth Opportunity programs.
Fort Worth, Texas Goodman & Associates, Inc*
Mobilization of media, and resulting heavy support of JOBS program,
strong factor in Fort Worth becoming first city to reach JOBS quota.
New York, N. Y. Young & Rubicam, Inc.
"Give A Damn" the strong campaign theme developed for TV, radio and
transit advertising. Effort directed to getting affluent community to
provide jobs and recreational opportunities, and contribute to Mayor's
$U million drive for summertime opportunity development and Urban Coalition.
Commuter card: "When this train gets to 12J>th Street, look out the window.
Give a damn." Agency sent creative group to experience life in the ghetto
before developing campaign. Theme line adapted to J. Walter Thompson
advertising kit material.
